result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian L Bankes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Specified Harm Did Not Occur), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brian L Bankes in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Brian L Bankes.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard, ready to proceed. 
Atty Steiner is heard. 

10:04 AM Atty Key breaks to speak with defendant. 
10:05 AM Atty Key and Defendant ready to proceed. 

Atty Steiner is heard on amending charge to misdemeanor battery. 

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews elements with the defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews min/max penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding.  

Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant entered a no contest plea. 
Court accepts defendants no contest pleas and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters plea. 

948.21(2)(a) Count 1: NEGLECTING A CHILD - SPECIFIED HARM DID NOT OCCUR (No Contest Plea)
940.19(1) Count 2: MISDEMEANOR BATTERY (No Contest Plea) 

State is heard on sentence recommendation. State requests on both county 2 years probation - sentence to be withheld, defendant to participate and follow through with any assessments, counseling or programming deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections. 60 days of conditional jail. No objection to EM. 

Witness is heard. 
Atty Key is heard. Requests electronic monitoring. 
Defendant is heard. 

Court orders the amendment of the charge to the 2 misdemeanor charges. 
Court orders for both counts - 2 years probation, sentence withheld. Defendant is ordered to participate in counseling. Defendant is to participate in counseling until the provider deems he has satisfied his counseling requirements. Court costs for each of the two counts. Total of $886.00 in court costs. PP approved. $100.00 per mo. PP Commencing September 1, 2022

Count 1 - 60 days of conditional jail; EM/Huber approved. To commence immediately. No sentence credit. Bond to be applied.

End 10:44
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

9:01 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brian L Bankes in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Brian L Bankes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Key is heard on the status of the case. Requests a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Request by Atty Key's Office to reschedule the 6/30/22 jury status hearing due to a scheduling conflict.  No objection by DA Steiner.  JA approved and rescheduled to 7/7/22 at 9:00 AM by Zoom.
Jury status hearing on July 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:33 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brian L Bankes in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key appeared by video for Brian L Bankes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court accepts waiver and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Atty Key is heard. Defendant pleads not guilty, court accepts the defendants not guilty plea. Clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury status hearing on June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer - Atty Daniel M Key

Adjustment Number: 22A 000649,
Payable Number: 70595,
Receipt Number: 22R 001156,
Amount: $20.00

1:37 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Brian L Bankes in court.  Attorney Daniel M Key in court for Brian L Bankes.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.   

State requests a signature bond with standard conditions. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 signature bond with standard conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
